name: WestCord City Centre Hotel Amsterdam

reviews.text: I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance of the train station and I would be able to save money taking the train to and from Schipol Airport. I was very happy with my choice. The room was not that large but large enough. (My wife and I got the double bed we requested but were warned by the front desk that the rooms with two single beds are larger.) There was both a trouser press in our room and an ironing room on the floor (the 1st floor). The bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. They offer a buffet breakfast for 10 Euros but I can't comment any further on it as my wife and I chose not to partake in it.
reviews.title: Would Stay Here Again

reviews.text: My husband and two of our friends stayed at this hotel from the 5th till the 7th of Feb.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel -

reviews.text: I loved everything about it, ideal location and the staff was lovely and friendly. The hotel was clean and everything that we needed and wanted.
reviews.title: Satisfactory choice

reviews.text: Myself and my husband are going back in the summer to the same hotel.
reviews.title: Ok for the money

reviews.text: Visited the Ramada during mid May. We had booked a double room with a safe and had changed all of our money on the strength of this. Our room turned out to be a twin room with no safe. The reception told us it was first come first serve with double rooms (even though we booked the room in January) and the refurbished rooms no longer have safes. They also refused to look after our money in their safe, and told us leaving it in our room was at our risk. Oh well!
reviews.title: No double rooms

reviews.text: Aside from this the room although very small was comfortable ( but the glass wall to the bathroom was very strange!) Breakfast was very good with a choice of cooked and/or continental.
reviews.title: choose this hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel is very central with a tram stop just outside which is perfect to get you to the museums. if you want to visit the Anne Frank house and the Van Gogh museum then buy tickets in advance from the tourist office at the station to save queuing.
reviews.title: Glass bathroom walls!
Great Location - But Shoddy Customer Service
reviews.text: Stayed at Ramada over Easter and I think it was a perfect choise. The hotel is located about 5 min walk from the central station, which is located 15 min from the airport with train (3,6€). We stayed in at Star Room at the 5. floor with at great view over the roof of Amsterdam. There was no noise at all to hear from our room. The room, yes it was'nt big but nice and very trendy. I also wonderd about about the glaswall to the bathroom - a bit strange if your are traveling with friends!. The Star rooms are only at the 5. and 6 floor, the other floors look old and used. We booked our room incl. breakfirst, but when we arrived we where told that that breakfirst was "french" which means only coffe and a crossint. If we wanted normal breakfirst we had to pay 7,5 € each pr. day - which we then did and got a great breakfirst, but I think they could have informed os about the "french" breakfirst at booking it.

reviews.title: OK to stay
reviews.text: Only at few minuts walk from the hotel are all the things you nead to se in Amsterdam. We also went to the flowerpark Keukenhof outside Amsterdam, great park with so many beautiful flowers. We took the train to Leiden and from there the bus directly to the park, it costed os about 25£ each incl. entrance and we spend most of a day there.

description: WestCord City Centre Hotel Amsterdam is a lively three-star hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. Dam Square, Kalverstraat and Haarlemmerdijk are all three minutes away. The hotel has 106 comfortable bedrooms. There is free internet throughout the hotel, and a computer with internet access is available. The hotel has a warm lobby, where you can drink a cup of coffee. In the morning you can enjoy an extensive breakfast buffet in breakfast restaurant Piazza D’Oro.If you’re coming to Amsterdam by car, you can park just outside the door in garage ‘De Kolk’. Trams stop just in front of the hotel, the ideal way to see Amsterdam conveniently. Bicycles. Amsterdam Central Station is five minutes’ walk away.
